docs.snippet: HOCHBERGER--Samuel Michael. On July 2 in Havertown PA, after a valiant battle of several years with myelodysplastic syndrome, at the age of 90. Predeceased by beloved wife of 58 years, Jane Weiss Hochberger. Longtime resident of Dunwoody Village, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: HOCHBERGER--Samuel Michael. On July 2 in Havertown PA, after a valiant battle of several years with myelodysplastic syndrome, at the age of 90. Predeceased by beloved wife of 58 years, Jane Weiss Hochberger. Longtime resident of Dunwoody Village, Newtown Square PA, and Villanova PA. Adored father of Ruth (Martin Flumenbaum) of New York NY, Larry, of Bryn Mawr PA, and Michael (Shelley Dropkin), of New York NY. Doting grandfather of Martha, David and Judy Flumenbaum, and Nathan, Rachel, Jacob and Eric Hochberger. Predeceased by sisters Sadye Freeman, Agnes Aron, Beatie Minstein and Laura Regenbogen. Born and raised in New York, NY. Proud alumnus of Stuyvesant High School and Colorado School of Mines, where he played varsity football and baseball. Captain in U.S. Army during World War II in the European Theatre, where he received the Bronze Star for construction of a bridge over the Roer River (Germany) while under mortar and artillery fire, and fought at the Bridge at Remagen. A mining engineer, he built the largest explosives distributor business in Pennsylvania and Maryland, Maurer & Scott, Inc., and Blasting Supplies, Inc. Generous to a fault, rugged individualist, enthusiastic tennis player, intrepid traveler, avid debater of politics, frustrated Phillies and Eagles fan. Former vice president of Main Line Reform Temple. Contributions welcome to Colorado School of Mines, P.O. Box 4005, Golden CO 80402, or Beth Chaim Reform Congregation, Box 1198, Malvern PA 19355. Funeral service private.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  HOCHBERGER, SAMUEL MICHAEL

docs.abstract: Scratch-off lottery tickets, cards covered with waxy coating that hide possible cash prize, were popularized in 1970s by John Koza and Dan Bower, who transformed a supermarket promo card into a product for state lottery commissions.

headline.main: Who Made That Scratch-Off Lottery Ticket?

docs.snippet: His grandfather was a mighty Hollywood force, but Casey Wasserman has chosen the sports world for making his mark, with a rapidly growing management and marketing firm....
docs.lead_paragraph: His grandfather was a mighty Hollywood force, but Casey Wasserman has chosen the sports world for making his mark, with a rapidly growing management and marketing firm.
docs.abstract: Casey Wasserman, grandson of Hollywood force Lew Wasserman, is chief executive of Wasserman Media Group, one of the largest sports agencies in the world, representing 1,300 athletes; $150 million business negotiates television and endorsement deals and handles naming rights for billion-dollar complexes.

headline.main: A Sports Agent With Hollywood in His Blood
headline.print_headline: A Sports Agent With Hollywood in His Blood
